item.title: 7 Cross-Platform Games That Are Best Played On Mobile
item.description:
Summary

  • Brawlhalla offers cross-play across all platforms, similar to Super Smash Bros.
  • Genshin Impact is enjoyable on mobile, great story, colorful design, and exploration.
  • Sky: Children of the Light, allows social interaction, seven realms to explore, available on multiple platforms.

Cross-platform games are great, as they allow players to share common interests and enjoy the same titles regardles of the console or device they own. While some video game franchises take the leap from consoles to mobile, others simply started on that platform and then branched out.

Regardless, it’s undeniable that, while having the option to enjoy a title across all platforms is a great advantage to have, some games play better on the go. This can be true for mobile card games, for example, and a few other genres for that matter. Here are some of the best cross-platform games that are best played on mobile .

7 Brawlhalla

Great For Fans Of The Super Smash Bros Franchise

Brawlhalla
8.3 /10
Released
October 17, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Fantasy Violence
Powered by
  • Various characters to choose from
  • Classic arena fighting gameplay

To kick off this list, there's Brawlhalla , which offers cross-play throughout all platforms. This is great as it lets players who own any kind of console or mobile device compete against others. For players who are unfamiliar with this game, the best way to describe it is to refer to it as a very similar title to Super Smash Bros.

In general, the objective is to knock the opponent into areas outside visual boundaries. Players can choose from a wide variety of characters from different franchises. The beauty about cross-platform gaming is that there’s something for everyone. Those who aren’t fond of fighting games should instead check out the best offline mobile simulation games out there.

6 Genshin Impact

A Worldwide Hit That's Really Enjoyable On Mobile

6 Images
6 Images
Genshin Impact
8 /10
215
9.2 /10
Released
September 28, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen - Fantasy Violence, Alcohol Reference
Powered by
  • The Traveler arrives in the world of Teyvat to start their adventure
  • Colorful worlds and interesting game mechanics

This one will probably be quite controversial, as Genshin Impact plays wonderfully well on all platforms, especially on PC. However, there’s no denying that being able to take the game on the go and enjoy it virtually anywhere has its own set of advantages.

Taking place in the fantasy world of Teyvat, Genshin Impact follows the story of the Traveler after being separated from their twin. There are several great things to say about this game, including its wonderful gameplay, colorful world design, and interesting exploration options. Genshin Impact is, without a doubt, one of the best mobile RPGs of the 2020s.

5 Sky: Children Of The Light

An Exciting Title With Much To Discover

Sky: Children of Light
Released
April 10, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by
  • Social mechanics play a big role in the experience
  • Seven different realms players can explore

While it was first released on iOS in 2019, Sky: Children of the Light is now available across various platforms, including Android, the Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, and Windows. This allows more players to take part of the action and enjoy this all-around outstanding title.

The world consists of seven unique realms, each one with different things to discover and areas to explore. There’s also quite a heavy focus on social mechanics and players can meet and befriend one another, as well as send each other gifts. Said social mechanics could make it seem like Sky: Children of the Light is a mobile game similar to Animal Crossing , but in reality, they’re two very different experiences.

4 Among Us

A Simple Game That Has Taken Over The World

Among Us
8.6 /10
Released
June 5, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Mild Blood, Fantasy Violence
Powered by
  • Players must complete tasks around the ship
  • It's critical to figure out who the Impostor is to win

When Among Us first hit online outlets, it was received with instant success and critical acclaim. This is quite puzzling to many, as it’s not really a game that is meant to blow players’ minds with its amazing graphics or overly complex gameplay. Still, what it has to offer is more than enough to be a mainstream title at this point. It could even be said that the game has become a pop-culture reference.

There’s just something about completing tasks around the ship while trying to survive the Impostor and figuring them out that is interesting and entertaining. Those who are looking for a more complex experience might want to check out the best mobile games published by Rockstar instead.

3 Hearthstone

A Fun, Turn-Based Experience With Collectible Cards

Hearthstone
7.5 /10
Released
March 11, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol Reference, Blood, Fantasy Violence, Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by
  • Turn-based experience
  • Based on the World of Warcraft universe's lore

There’s probably not a player in the world who hasn’t played or at least heard of the World of Warcraft universe, as it’s been around for a few decades at this point, and it’s widely popular. Hearthstone builds upon the existing lore of said universe and presents players with an interesting experience based on collectible cards.

As opposed to some other titles on this list, Hearthstone is turn-based, which might be fun for some, but not so much so for others who prefer faster-paced action. For the latter, perhaps trying out some of the best DC mobile games out there might be a better alternative.

2 Stardew Valley

Managing A Farm Is More Fun On The Go

Stardew Valley
74
9.2 /10
Released
February 26, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone (Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Mild Language, Simulated Gambling, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco)
Powered by
  • Players must restore their grandfather's farm back to its former glory
  • It's possible to grow seasonal crops, and raise animals, along with other activities

Stardew Valley is so popular that it’s not only well-known among those players who like farm life simulation games, but also among those who don’t. Some of the activities players can engage in while playing this game are growing seasonal crops, raising animals, and more.

The game begins when the main character leaves the hectic city life they were used to and moves to the outskirts of Pelican Town to bring their deceased grandfather’s farm back to its former glory. Those who enjoy games that bring them peace and paint a pretty picture of a rural lifestyle will most certainly love Stardew Valley .

1 Slay The Spire

A Deck Building Game That Is Challenging And Fun

  • Four different characters to choose from
  • Character-specific cards

Similar to Hearthstone , Slay the Spire is also based on deck building. The main objective of the game is to try to ascend a spire of several floors that are procedurally-generated while battling various enemies and bosses. There are four different characters to choose from.

At the beginning of the game, players start with a specific amount of health, gold, and a personal relic that gives them a unique ability. There are also character-specific cards, so players must carefully choose who they’ll play as to aid their strategies.

item.title: Dungeons and Dragons Making Big Change to D&D Beyond
item.description:
Dungeons and Dragons is giving fans full access to the Maps virtual tabletop through D&D Beyond with no subscription required starting September 16. Though players can unlock additional customizability through subscriptions, all Dungeons and Dragons fans will be able to use this official VTT at no cost soon.

Maps is an official new Dungeons and Dragons virtual tabletop program by Wizards of the Coast that features full integration with D&D Beyond . Right now, the program allows players with a Master Tier subscription to D&D Beyond to become Dungeon Master for their friends using the maps, monsters, and other content they already own on the platform, enabling digital Dungeons and Dragons games to be played on any device with an internet connection.

Maps Without D&D Beyond Subscriptions Starting September 16

However, Dungeons and Dragons recently announced a big change to this VTT that will change it for the better. In a new blog post on D&D Beyond , Dungeons and Dragons franchise head Dan Ayoub confirmed that Maps will soon be available for free to all fans. Accessing the VTT will still require a D&D Beyond account, but players will no longer need a subscription in order to run games using their unlocked content on Maps , including modules and adventures.

That said, there will still be some advanced functions that will only be available to Master Tier subscribers. These fans will gain the ability to upload third-party maps and tokens, and use “exciting tools” to further customize their virtual Dungeons and Dragons games.

That wasn’t all Ayoub announced in this blog post. New initiatives to strengthen community voices are underway, with two major projects currently in progress: a rotating advisory group, and a creator spotlight program. The former will be a council of creators, publishers, educators, and fans who can help “shape future tools, policies, and content in a real, ongoing way” that is constantly shifting to ensure varied voices are always being heard. The latter will be avenues to celebrate the homebrew Dungeons and Dragons creations of fans and third-party publishers on official channels. There is no word on when these programs will launch, but D&D has expressed its commitment to “clearer communication, more transparency, and consistent support” by building “lasting collaborations” – and not as a “one-time survey or a PR move” – so fans will probably hear more about them soon.

In the meantime, Dungeons and Dragons recently showed off its next two books: Forgotten Realms: Heroes of Faerun and Adventures in Faerun , which feature Baldur’s Gate 3 favorites like Karlach, Minsc, and Astarion. These books are available for pre-order in both physical and digital copies, and are set to release on November 11.

item.title: How To Get Crow Feather Piece In Grounded 2
item.description:
As players explore Brookhollow Park in Grounded 2 , they will stumble upon many useful items that will facilitate their journey in the long run. One of these items is the Crow Tail Feather, which will give Crow Feather Pieces for players to craft arrows.

How To Get A Crow Feather Piece In Grounded 2

To get a Crow Feather Piece, you must locate and break a Crow Tail Feather in Grounded 2 . Luckily, there is no need to kill huge birds or look for nests, as the Crow Tail Feather is found on the ground or in slightly high areas. There are two feathers right south of the Snackbar Front, which is where you must go for one of the main quests to discover a Ranger Station, making the location perfect for early game players.

From the Ranger Outpost: Snackbar, head south by running on foot or riding a buggy in Grounded 2 , until you reach the Entrance area. While traveling south, players will encounter a blue circular object in the middle of the road. Climb it to find a Crow Tail Feather.

Just a bit southeast of the previous feather location, you will find another tail feather on the lower ground. However, be careful as it might have a Bombardier Beetle walking near it. You can farm the Crow Feather Pieces by going to these two locations occasionally once the material respawn to get as much as you need.

If you are unable to break the feather tail, then you must upgrade your Omni-Axe to level II using the Ranger Station. Players need to gather Roach Chunks , Blueberry Leather , and have at least 2000 Raw Science . Roaches are found almost everywhere in the park, while blueberries can be picked up from the Picnic Table and then dried on a Drying Rack to become leather.

Once players destroy the feather and get the Crow Feather Pieces, they can now head back to the Outpost and analyze it to unlock some recipes. Interact with any Workbench to craft some of these recipes in Grounded 2 :

Recipe

Required Materials

Bunk Bed

  • Weed Stem x8
  • Acorn Shell x5
  • Crow Feather Piece x5

Simple Bed

  • Weed Stem x4
  • Clay x4
  • Acorn Shell x2
  • Crude Rope x6
  • Crow Feather Piece x2

Pointy Rounds

  • Thistle Needle x20
  • Crow Feather Piece x1

Marksman's Cap

  • Blueberry Leather x5
  • Silk Rope x5
  • Crow Feather Piece x5

Feather Arrow

  • Silk Rope x3
  • Crow Feather Piece x1

Craft Variety of Arrows Using Feather Arrow

Venom Arrow

  • Feather Arrow x5
  • Spider Venom x1

Mint Arrow

  • Feather Arrow x10
  • Mint Shard x1

Spicy Arrow

  • Feather Arrow x10
  • Spicy Shard x1

Disruptor Arrow

  • Feather Arrow x5
  • O.R.C Receiver x1

9 Images
9 Images

item.title: Anti-Steam Censorship Petition Hits a Massive Milestone
item.description:
The biggest anti- Steam censorship petition to date has surpassed 200,000 signatures and is still showing few signs of slowing down. It has thus completely dwarfed the original petition that called for forcibly censoring Steam before payment processors stepped in, granting that wish.

Shortly after Valve started delisting hundreds of adult games from its digital storefront in mid-July 2025, Steam users began rallying behind an anti-censorship petition on change.org. The initiative amassed thousands of signatures within its first few days, its momentum closely mirroring the ongoing social media backlash sparked by the actions of Australian activist group Collective Shout, which successfully lobbied payment processors to help with delisting some types of fetish games.

New Steam Petition Triples the Support of Pro-Censorship Activists in Much Less Time

Over the course of the ten days that followed, the anti-Steam censorship petition blew up from about 16,000 signatures on July 22 to nearly 224,000 as of the afternoon of August 2 (ET). To put this into perspective, in just over two weeks, the petition collected more than three times as many signatures as Collective Shout's campaign did in four months. It has so far managed to maintain its momentum, with its change.org page showing an already sizable and still growing list of press coverage and social media attention.

Steam Users Accuse Visa and MasterCard of Hypocrisy, Not Separating Games from Reality

The petition has received several updates since its inception in mid-July 2025, largely reiterating its original talking points. Chief among them is the view that payment processors are being hypocritical in what they choose to sanction, targeting legal content featuring digital characters while overlooking industries like pornography, which petitioners argue exploit real people. "These 'activist groups' do not speak for everyone," posits the petition’s creator, signed as Zero Ryoko.

These “activist groups” do not speak for everyone.

To date, Steam has removed in excess of 400 adult games as part of the ongoing censorship wave. Collective Shout claimed it only went after the most extreme fetish content, featuring themes like incest, rape, and child abuse. The group's detractors are framing this point as moot. "Fiction is not reality," Ryoko wrote on the initial version of his petition's landing page. He further asserted that artistic vision and market freedom alike need to be respected and protected in any "healthy, democratic society."

The recent wave of censorship even made Itch.io hide all adult games from its search results while it manually reviews them for potential violations of payment processors' vague rules. The indie-focused platform also confirmed it is actively seeking new partners to handle transactions without imposing moral judgments on legal content. Given its size, Valve is unlikely to drop Visa and MasterCard voluntarily, as the two companies account for the vast majority of the world's payment processing, apart from China. At Valve’s scale, no single alternative appears viable, so replacing them would ostensibly require integrating with numerous smaller regional processors.

item.title: Blox Fruits: Best Races For PvP, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Shark is a tank race, but becomes an easy target once defense drops.
  • Rabbit offers unmatched speed but lacks defensive abilities, making it volatile.
  • Human provides insane combos, uncancellable attacks, and is a nightmare in high-tier PvP.

In the high-stakes world of Blox Fruits PvP, a player’s race is the factor that separates routine wins from legendary outplays. The game’s meta shifts with every update, but right now, the strongest races do far more than hand out small stat bonuses. They unlock new rules, warp the pace of combat, and make sure that the player’s next combo will be remembered (or regretted) by everyone on the server.

The arrival of V4 awakenings has turned the PvP landscape upside down. Once, V3 skills were the top prize; now, V4 transformations dominate the meta, blending perfectly with Fruits, Fighting Styles, and weapons. Therefore, each pick on this list comes with its own risk, reward, and playstyle—so get ready to see where each race stands and how it can benefit the next match.

7 Shark (Fishman)

Tank For A Moment, Target For The Rest

  • V4 passive: Leviathan’s Armor
  • V4 ability: Whirlpool

Shark is the go-to race for players who love the idea of soaking up damage like a wall, but in the current meta, this “tank” quickly turns into the arena’s punching bag. Its V3 ability, Water Body, provides a massive 65-70% damage reduction, and its V4 Awakening, Leviathan's Armor, can boost that to an incredible 85%. However, this only lasts for a few seconds.

The moment that shield drops, every serious player knows it’s hunting season. Skilled opponents bait out Shark’s big defensive cooldown, then unleash a full combo with zero fear of reprisal. It’s a classic trap: seeming invincible, only to be exposed and punished the second the shield’s down.

6 Rabbit (Mink)

Comes With An Unmatched But Risky Speed

  • V4 passive: Lightning Cloak
  • V4 ability: Whirlwind

Rabbit is all about pure speed, like Sonic the Hedgehog after a triple espresso. V3 “Agility” and V4 “Lightning Cloak” turn users into a blur, allowing them to control their engagement distance and also escape danger. However, this incredible speed comes at a steep price: Rabbit has absolutely no defensive abilities.

One slip, one stun, and it's lights out. The mobility ceiling is sky-high, but so is the risk. PvP in Blox Fruits is loaded with deadly one-shot combos and stuns—if Rabbit gets tagged, then there’s nothing else players can do to help themselves. For the rare player with god-tier movement, Rabbit can seem like a menace, but for most, it's extremely volatile.

5 Human

Race That Rewards With Insane Combos

  • V4 passive: Psycho
  • V4 ability: Limit Break

Human used to be the joke of the meta—until the V4 buffs. Now, this is the ultimate "high-risk, high-reward" pick for players who thrive under pressure. The kit revolves around dealing insane damage when at low health. V3 “Last Resort” pushes attack power through the roof as HP drops, while the V4 “Psycho” ability gives an explosive burst of invisible Flash Steps that open up new combo routes.

What really sets Human apart in high-tier PvP is the uncancellable attacks. V4 Human’s moves don’t get stopped by auras or disruptions, making it a nightmare for anyone hoping to interrupt a key skill. With strong mobility and sky-high damage, Human is a great counter-pick versus races that rely on breaking combos.

4 Draco

The Brawler Who Punishes Every Attacker

  • V4 passive: Thorn Mail
  • V4 ability: Cometic Field

Draco is the brawler’s dream—tough, disruptive, and loaded with uniquely punishing mechanics. V1 and V2 offer early durability and minor buffs, but everything changes with V4. “Thorn Mail” reflects a chunk of incoming damage, so anyone who spams combos eats some of their own attack back. Whereas V3, “Primordial Reign,” lets users speed up, hit harder, slow down enemies, and even cancel enemy moves if timed right.

The V4 “Cometic Field” brings explosive AoE orbs and party-wide buffs, making Draco scary in both 1v1s and team fights. The only real catch? Unlocking Draco is a grind, and the rarity makes it less common in the wild. But for those who finish the gauntlet, Draco is an absolute monster.

3 Angel

Sky Ruler Who Comes With Healing, Flight, And Stun Aura

  • V4 passive: Prince of the Skies
  • V4 ability: King’s Rule

Angel is the PvP meta’s survival king, mastering both self-healing and air superiority. V3 “Heavenly Blood” heals a fifth of the HP and buffs defense, which is perfect for bouncing back mid-fight. However, its V4 Awakening is what makes it a top-tier menace. The “Prince of the Skies” ability grants true, free-form flight, allowing players to adopt the infamous "sky-camping" strategy.

Furthermore, the centerpiece of Angel's kit is King's Rule, a V4 ability that projects a golden aura around the player that stuns, slows, and drains any enemy who gets close. Also, Melee-focused fighting styles are completely negated, as the aura instantly breaks their combos before they can even start.

2 Cyborg

The Ultimate Combo Enabler And Ken Haki Disruptor

  • V4 passive: Energy Control
  • V4 ability: Aftershock

Cyborg is a nightmare in the PvP meta for players who rely on dodging or fear getting caught in combos. V3 “Energy Core” does more than look flashy. It breaks Observation Haki (Ken), leaving opponents completely exposed for a guaranteed combo finisher. With Cyborg, a stun will land, follow-up attacks will connect, and getting the kill is almost certain.

Defensively, both V2 and V3 bring strong damage reduction. V4 adds more with “Aftershock” and “Energy Control,” which deliver AOE damage, damage-over-time effects, and burst mobility using the Soul Guitar technique. For any player who centers their build around landing a single, decisive combo, Cyborg is an unparalleled choice.

1 Ghoul

The Monster Who Comes With A Cooldown-Breaker

  • V4 passive: Blood Siphon
  • V4 ability: Domain Expansion

Ghoul stands at the top of the current PvP meta. This race offers the best healing, nonstop offensive pressure, and unmatched cooldown control. Ghoul V2’s life leech heals every attack—whether it’s a punch, kick, or slash. V4 “Domain Expansion” reduces all ability cooldowns and keeps skills ready almost all the time.

Ghoul is not just about higher damage or greater defense. This race changes the entire flow of a match. Players can spam powerful abilities, heal lost HP, blind and anti-heal enemies, and completely prevent counterattacks. Furthermore, Ghoul works with almost any build, and competitive players widely fear it because it doesn’t give them a chance to breathe or recover.
